Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Caerin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus cereus (MIC=50 µg/ml), Leuconostoc lactis (MIC=25 µg/ml), Listeria innocua (MIC=12 µg/ml), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=12 µg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC=12 µg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC=12 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=25 µg/ml), Streptococcus uberis (MIC=25 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Pasteurella multocida (MIC=50 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Shows significant activity against Gram-positive organisms, but is less effective against Gram-negative organisms.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.

Literature.Title: New caerin antibiotic peptides from the skin secretion of the Dainty Green Tree Frog Litoria gracilenta. Identification using positive and negative ion electrospray mass spectrometry.
Literature.Author: Maclean MJ, Brinkworth CS, Bilusich D, Bowie JH, Doyle JR, Llewellyn LE, Tyler MJ.
